review: found this lurking in my library from what must have been a humble bundle years ago not bad but no work of genius either gameplay is serviceable story is a fairly unsubtle metaphor for having an alcoholic parentauthority figure in a way that feels like it was meant for a younger audience like give this to an eight year old who is going through this kind of thing  three outta five
the game industry desperately needs games made outside of the western and asian lens and papo  yo is exactly that great game
great music  sfx  nice puzzles varied mechanics  good graphics  platforming is slightly clunky
a platformer that answers the question what if mc escher was brazilian also wrote and directed inception and turned it all into a video game
i played it 8 years ago i am still stunned and speechless   it deserved way more attention than it ever got
good
this game makes me cry 3
amazing

papo  yo is only a couple of hours long and the gameplay isnt that challenging or innovative but the themes that this game covers and the unique art design that it uses to bring the story to the player are beautiful substance abuse can be extremely damaging to those that experience or witness it and the game conveys this in a colorful yet incredibly raw manner  the music throughout the game is also great and adds layers to the emotion that the game is trying to express
a cathartic experience for people with one or more dysfunctional parent
all i can say is what an amazing story
pretty game i definitely like the inceptionesque puzzleplatform parts and the story has some heartfelt moments even tho i think its resolution is pretty dull 25
solid puzzle game very innovative cute a little bit depressing
i played this with my dad when i was younger i love this game it brings back good memories

papo  yo which i first played on the ps3 nearly a decade ago is a very beautiful game with great music visuals and story that you can beat in an afternoon the pc port is definitely the definitive version to play as well

good game platforming was a little clunky at times such as getting stuck on seemingly nothing but it was smooth enough during the parts that mattered  the real star of the show is the storythemescharacters  its emotional but some of the metaphors were maybe a little too on the nose but im nitpicking  very unique game and it hits hard especially for people with experience of substance abuse in their family
is good

an impactful game that uses clever puzzle design that never seems quite too hard to get in the way of an interesting atmosphere and story
a beautiful and often tragic story the gameplay is a competent platformer occasionally with some simple puzzles absolutely worth your time
the story is touching the music is good puzzles are ok

a few technical issues aside this is a unique game with interesting mechanics a rarely seen location in gaming an amazing soundtrack and a very serious story underneath it all trigger warnings for sure but an impressive and emotional experience for those who can play it
a heartfelt game that moved me to tears

if you wanna play a puzzle platformer and probably end up crying at the end then this is the game for you its fun to puzzle out what to do to progress and the story gives a glimpse into an experience that you may not have been exposed to before

this is a very intriguing game  for some strange reason it really made an impression on me and i kept thinking about it for days after i finished it  be sure to checkout the wiki on this before you begin to understand whats going on and look up on youtube one of the walk through videos to guide you when you get stuck

this is one of those games where you can definitely make the argument for video games as art  its a puzzle platformer which is pretty simple and also pretty short  but it tells a beautiful tale of the effect that addition has upon children  its definitely one of those hidden gems that you should especially buy if on sale
fun puzzles platforming and psychologically deep allegorical story

on the outside it looks like a delightful puzzle platformer with the main characters being children in the favelas of south america a toy robot and a seemingly gentle giant pink monster under the surface it deals with some dark themes like alcohol abuse and domestic abuse the art style and music is brilliant
cute story fun game

interesting game with one of the most sensitive subject family puzzle is fun and fresh like kids perspective but the ending is a bit pointless in fantasy world is yes good advice but in real world not tell anything more than that but its a good experience people should play this game

very interesting game and with a lot of meaning definetly worth to check it out

interesting and a bit boring at times for me in the beginning but overall a wonderful game it tells an absolutely heartbreaking story and ends with a bittersweet resolution papo y yo hits close to home and while it made me incredibly sad back then im left off feeling happy for quico now though the soundtrack gets me every time and i cant help but to tear up id recommend this game more for the story than for the puzzles
quanit and well done puzzle game good graphics even several years after release recommended stopped playing as it was hard to pick back up after a few hours with some many other games to enjoy

very much in the vein of ico this is an adventure game with light puzzle solving its probably the easiest entry tot he genre but what it lacks in difficulty it more than makes up for in its story and pacing its a very short title but it delivers its best ideas  one right after the other and does not outstay its welcome i very much recommend it if youre looking for something along the lines of ico brothers tale of two sons journey  rime
